hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin/BTC Divergence Reversal on Broad Market Stress
hypothesis_content.statement: When major altcoins (top 10 ex-BTC/ETH) show 2-day outperformance (>8%) vs BTC during NEUTRAL regimes, and then a broad market stress event occurs (like the XRP volatility spillover mentioned), these altcoins will experience accelerated mean reversion, underperforming BTC by an additional 3-5% over the next 3 days as safety flows to BTC.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During stress events, capital flees to the perceived safety and liquidity of BTC, reversing recent altcoin outperformance. The XRP volatility news exemplifies cross-asset contagion. This creates a reliable 'flight to quality' pattern that's especially pronounced when altcoins have recently outperformed.
entry_conditions: Altcoin index (top 10 ex-BTC/ETH) 2-day return vs BTC > 8%
Market regime shifts to STRESS OR volatility spike detected (BTC 1-day realized vol > 80%)
Cross-asset volatility mention in news (like 'XRP dropped 5%, causing volatility')
BTC funding rates turn negative or neutral (not excessively positive)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Altcoin index vs BTC returns to its 20-day average OR 10% relative underperformance
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Altcoin index continues outperforming vs BTC by another 3%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Altcoins continue outperforming BTC during stress events in >40% of cases, indicating changing market structure where altcoins are seen as safe havens.
